articles.title: Super Bowl 2026: Bad Bunny performs joyful, controversy-free halftime show
articles.description:
Bad Bunny's Super Bowl halftime show was a joyful ode to Latin culture, featuring guests including Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin.

The post Super Bowl 2026: Bad Bunny performs joyful, controversy-free halftime show appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Bad Bunny's halftime show celebrated Latin culture during Super Bowl 2026 in Boston.
Guests included Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin, enhancing the event's star power.
The performance fosters cultural appreciation among Boston's diverse communities.

articles.title: Yes, there was a real wedding during Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl halftime show
articles.description:

summary: Bad Bunny incorporated a real wedding during the Super Bowl halftime show on February 12, 2023.

Boston residents witnessed a unique blend of local culture and entertainment during the Super Bowl.

articles.title: Mass. State Police report fake account impersonating trooper
articles.description:
The account appears to have more than 100,000 followers. A similar account with nearly 300,000 appears to impersonates a Santa Monica officer.

The post Mass. State Police report fake account impersonating trooper appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Mass. State Police warn about a fake account impersonating a trooper.

Residents are urged to report suspicious accounts to prevent misinformation.

articles.title: In Patriots territory, Seahawks fans find a home base for the Super Bowl
articles.description:

summary: Union Street cantina hosts Seahawks fans during Super Bowl festivities.

articles.title: Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center after train derails
articles.description:
A Green Line car derailed at Park Street station, causing service suspension between Park Street and Government Center, MBTA says.

The post Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center after train derails appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Green Line service suspended between Park Street and Government Center due to a train derailment.
MBTA confirmed the derailment occurred on February 8, 2026, affecting daily commuters.
Passengers must seek alternative transportation options during the service disruption.
